metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Second Sunday after Pentecost

kernfrasen: parent of a child... on the verge of self-destruction
inner core of being is love
pay a ransom, mortgage the house
enough credits to come into the presence of God
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS DEBT / SALVATION IS DEBT CANCELLATION

kernfrasen: there is no health in us

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The love of one human being... is only a hint of the perfect love of God.

cognitieve_implicaties: Human love is real but qualitatively inferior to divine love.
theologische_implicaties: The Trinity is the source of all relationality.
ethische_implicaties: Human relationships should be modeled after the self-giving of the Trinity.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May imply God is just a 'bigger' version of human emotion.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'God is Love' clich√© by grounding it in the visceral anxiety of a parent with a runaway child.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the Relational and Economic domains by framing 'redemption' not as a cold transaction, but as the 'ransom' a desperate parent pays for a child.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: SIN IS SICKNESS (no health in us)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Sickness implies a lack of agency, while 'offender' implies moral culpability.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: One requires a doctor, the other a judge.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The economic cost (mortgaging the house) is used to quantify the depth of relational devotion.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the Trinitarian formula by linking it to Paul's 'agonized' emotional state.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'Desperate Parent' metaphor might project human anxiety and lack of control onto the Sovereignty of God.
risicos.voorbeeld: In desperation he writes an impassioned, erratic letter.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants may view God as reactive rather than providential.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A household in crisis (drugs, anorexia, runaway child).
sub_worlds: The 'Depths' (De Profundis) as a dark pit or prison.
The Watchman waiting for the dawn.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Strong emotional pivot from love to the need for mercy.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforced through the lens of parental sacrifice and 'foolish' love.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Repudiates the idea of 'adding up virtues' or 'petty record keeping'.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as the one who pays the ransom regardless of the child's response.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Book of Common Prayer and the liturgical calendar (Trinity Sunday).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational/Familial domain, specifically the 'Agonized Parent.' This is effectively used to bypass the 'dead' nature of Trinitarian formulas. The second half shifts to a Juridical/Economic domain to handle the concept of Sin, though it occasionally struggles with the tension between sin as a 'condition' (sickness) and sin as 'debt/crime.'

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'Ransom' imagery by connecting it back to the 'mortgaging the house' narrative.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God 'mortgages' his own glory to buy back his children.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Addiction' metaphor to bridge the two: addiction is both a sickness (no health) and involves choices (offender).

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: God might be seen as powerless or easily manipulated.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Resurrection Power' and 'Upholding the Universe' language used in the conclusion.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To provide stability to the 'erratic' and 'tumultuous' imagery of the first half.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The Church as a building founded on the Trinity.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to breathe life into dogmatic formulas. The use of the 'desperate parent' creates a powerful schema disruption for those who view the Trinity as a dry math problem.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the 'beauty' of the Trinitarian blessing, CMT reveals how it functions as a cognitive safety net for a fractured community.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'feeling' or 'thinking' to show how the physical experience of parenting maps onto the understanding of the Godhead.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher uses 'Economic' language (ransom/credits) specifically to subvert it with 'Relational' logic.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: last ditch of our messed-up lives
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Container' schema (In the depths, in Christ, in us) to describe the state of the soul.
